slides.title: What is Average?
slides.content:
**Average:** The central value of a set of numbers

**Formula:**
Average = Sum of all observations / Number of observations

**Example:** Average of 10, 20, 30
= (10+20+30)/3 = 60/3 = 20

slides.title: Important Formulas
slides.content:
**Sum of observations:**
Sum = Average × Number of observations

**Adding a new number:**
New Sum = Old Sum + New Number
New Average = New Sum / New Count

**Removing a number:**
New Sum = Old Sum - Removed Number

slides.title: Average of Special Series
slides.content:
**First n natural numbers:**
Average = (n+1)/2

**First n even numbers:**
Average = n+1

**First n odd numbers:**
Average = n

**Consecutive numbers:**
Average = (First + Last)/2

slides.title: Weighted Average
slides.content:
**When different groups have different weights:**

Weighted Average = (w₁×a₁ + w₂×a₂ + ...) / (w₁ + w₂ + ...)

**Example:** 30 students avg 40 marks, 20 students avg 60 marks
Overall avg = (30×40 + 20×60)/(30+20) = 2400/50 = 48
